definitions.definition: To connect , set up or prepare something for use

subdefinitions.definition: To transfer software onto a device's permanent storage and put it in a state where it is ready to be run when needed, usually decompressing it if necessary and performing any necessary pre-first-run configuration.
examples: I haven't installed the new operating system yet because of all the bugs.

definitions.definition: To admit formally into an office , rank or position .
examples: He was installed as Chancellor of the University.
I installed myself in my usual chair by the fire.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To connect , set up or prepare something for use
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To admit formally into an office , rank or position .
( transitive , sometimes reflexive ) To establish or settle in.
